column5: I'm heading up to simcoe on saturday morning and I usually get my minnows from Angling Specialities but they open at 9AM.  Do you guys know of any good shops that open early, around 6:30-7:00 I can pick up minnows from on the way up the 400?
Where ya going?  Gilford variety has them, open at 6 i think,  couple bait shops at 89/yonge st also open early
Doesn't the place just north of Vaughn kills open up at 5am?
Doesn't the place just north of Vaughn kills open up at 5am? Google True Canadian Outdoors,great selection and opens at 4am Sat and Sunday.Just off the 400 at Rutherford.
if you are going to the north end, Jacob's on 11 just before Orillia, open at 6, good price and good count
Google True Canadian Outdoors,great selection and opens at 4am Sat and Sunday.Just off the 400 at Rutherford. best shinners by scoop will last you all day
where are they located exactly. are they in one of the vaughn mills plazas?  google maps doesnt seem to show the exact spot
Located in the adjacent shops beside the v mills parking lot on the north side
Why not get them in Lefroy or in Barrie?
where are they located exactly. are they in one of the vaughn mills plazas?  google maps doesnt seem to show the exact spot Yup, just west of wild wing.

This thread should provide more specific directions; http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=70997&p=801977  You might want to remind the store owner to update his google location. If he hears it enough times, he might finally figure out the adventure of finding his business is likely costing him money. Good, healthy live bait though.
Why would an "out of towner"/"non-resident" want to spend their money in Barrie???  http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=73107

Why would an "out of towner"/"non-resident" want to spend their money in Barrie???  http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=73107  Why wouldn't they?   Because you're upset about some parking fees?  In a place that's not even near the laker/whitie/perch grounds?  Seriously man, don't come if the parking fees upset you that much.  I'm sure the city of Barrie won't give a lick.  I can't believe the people whining about that, it's pretty funny.
For the OP; Where's the bait shop in Lefroy? Are they open early?
Apologies to Redpearl for the hijack.
redpearl, are you fishing lakers/whities or perch?   Depending on which one, it will dictate which shop you go to

True canadian outdoors. I just stumbeled on it by mistake this past Saturday while looking for a place to refill my printers tonner... Really nice store with live bait and all immediate necessities Here is the stores info taken from their card that I grabbed,3175 Rutherford rd. Unit H46,vaughan, ontario, L4K 5Y6, 905 7619666, www.truecanadianoutdoors.com
The Bait Bucket in Barrie has big scoops.  But I don't know what time they are open.
The Bait Bucket in Barrie has big scoops.  But I don't know what time they are open.  6am.   Agreed on the big scoops as well.
89/11 has big scoops as well.Only one size though  .
